Introduction to the plant model

Daniel Falster

A brief introduction is provided here to get you started with plant. More extensive information and tutorials are available at the package website: https://traitecoevo.github.io/plant/, including

Details of the modelling approaches:

  • Modelling demography of plants, patches and metapopulations
  • The FF16 physiological strategy model

Details of using plant in R:

  • Plant level properties
  • The cohort spacing algorithm
  • Finding demographic equilibrium
  • Patch level dynamics
  • Patch level emergent properties
  • Calculating fitness
  • Modifying parameters of the physiological model

Examples

library(plant)

For a full list of available functions run library(help=plant), or see the online reference.

Strategy objects

s <- FF16_Strategy()

Hyper-parameterisation

Individual plants

Plants are constructed with the FF16_Plant function. That function takes as its only argument a “strategy” object; the default is FF16_Strategy, but alternative strategies can be provided (see below). The “strategy” object contains all the physiological underpinning the dynamics of individual plants and entire metapopulations.

pl <- FF16_Plant()
  • demographic rates
  • Grow to size
  • WPLCP

Metapopulations
